Description:
Former Smeaton Primary School circa 1910
An opportunity for the lover of heritage buildings and gardens to create a landmark property of the calibre of Musk Farm. Presenting as a fantastic opportunity to capitalise on the charm and endless character of a bygone era and transform into a beautiful home (STCA). Enjoy sweeping rural views & easy proximity to amenities, approximately 32kms north of Ballarat, 15kms north east of Creswick and 23kms west of Daylesford.
Stunning triple brick, heritage property
340.6m2 of accommodation, polished boards, soaring ceilings & gas heating
Magnificent total land size 1.012 hectares benefiting from three road frontages, allows scope for full renovation/landscaping and extension of current school house along with further development (STCA)
The two Certificates of Title, being Volume 2610 Folio 833 (8 lots) and Volume 2486 Folio 072 (2 lots)
Consider the opportunity for the separate on-sale of the existing lots, subject to appropriate servicing arrangements. Prospective purchasers should make their own enquiries concerning this opportunity
Asphalt paved tennis court
Numerous structural improvements including craft room (extension built 1963), pergola, 2 x toilet blocks, 2 x garden sheds, fernery and bicycle shelter
For garden lovers, tranquil country vistas and rich volcanic soils
Reticulated town water plus four water tanks with an aggregate capacity of approximately 100,000 litres
Septic tank connected
Zoning: Township, Hepburn Planning Scheme. Overlay control: Environmental Significance Overlay. Heritage Overlay Schedule (HO781). Designated Bushfire Prone Area

Description:
Beautiful Brand New Home
Built by McMasters just three years ago, this stunning brick veneer home delivers a straightforward design on a fabulous slightly sloping 902m2 allotment (approx.). Positioned just minutes from the centre of the Creswick, this property is ideal for young couples looking for the ultimate family home or perfect for those wishing to escape the rat race and live with a little serenity and space.
Designed with a central kitchen, adjoining dining and family room, along with a formal lounge, this three bedroom home provides central heating and good size windows and doors to connect with the outdoors along with providing a little cross ventilation benefit. Gleaming floor tiles and crisp white splashbacks create a glimmering base for the galley style kitchen, while a walk in pantry, overhead and under bench cupboards and drawers provide ample space for grocery and crockery storage.
Pampering the master is walk in robes and a stylish ensuite, while a fresh clean palette and durable tiles decorates the family bathroom, separate toilet, walk in linen press and independent laundry. Decorated in a neutral palette and finished with neat well thought out garden beds, this home with double lock up garage and internal access, is filled with natural light while sitting perfectly into the lay of the land. A well-drained fully concrete area is ready to take on the summer outdoors, while various plants have already begun to sprout to deliver a maintenance free landscape. NBN is available for connection; please contact our agent asap for inspection details.

Description:
Stylish Family Home Set On Big Block With Rear Access
Immaculately presented on a generous 957m2 allotment, this stylish family home benefits from its broad encircled verandas, its fabulous building orientation and by its sheer elegant blend of design and easy care gardens.
Splashed with vibrant colour and anchored by beautiful polished hardwood floors, the living room is comforted by an in built gas heater along with light and warmth from various windows which connect with the dining zone and kitchen. A tucked away appliance cupboard keeps preparation mess hidden away, while the freestanding 900mm stainless steel cooker provides versatility while cooking those larger meals, especially over Christmas.
Loads of storage is also evident with a generous walk in linen press along with built in robes in the three double size bedrooms. The family bathroom is styled with décor elements of its construction era, which could provide an easy task to uplift for a home handyman to attempt.
Presented with an easy care gardens and a large well protected alfresco zone, this outdoor space with raised gardens and built in BBQ, is ideal for street parties, family get togethers, casual barbecues or just provide the perfect place for children?s play.
Rear access is available with two 8x8m sheds adding a little further room for all those boy?s toys or gardening equipment, while a delightful fernery has been added for a refreshing spot to tinker amid the straightforward lawns and established trees.
Positioned just minutes from the bustling Township of Creswick, this relaxed family home could be ?just the thing? for those looking for nothing to do, but just move in! An inspection will certainly not disappoint for those discerning buyers.

Description:
Tradies Take A Look At This One!
With the bones of a gorgeous little miner?s cottage, yet offering the facade of a more recently updated home, this quaint cottage is ideal for those looking for a little project, while offering enough room to extend if necessary. Sitting on approx. 1000m2 and boasting fabulous vehicle cover, this home is flanked by a fully concreted 6 x 9m carport plus a 7 x 9m shed with double roller doors, concrete and power, a freestanding combustion heater and a built in bar. Various sundry sheds border the fence line, while the grounds are ready for a little landscaping care if gardening is your passion.
With a complete blank canvas and white wash walls inside, this three bedroom home is ideal for first home buyers, retirees or those blokes who love to spend most of their time in their shed. Whilst the wet areas are fully serviceable, a few updates could add a little value and further functionality through the kitchen and bathroom. Timber-like floors in the kitchen and laminate benches are offered with electric cooking while an original timber mantel features to one end which could be utilized in its makeover.
The bathroom has a new 900mm shower recess which creates a fashionable base, while all three bedrooms and lounge have been refreshed with white walls and durable soft grey toned carpet. A further freestanding wood heater provides comfort, with venetians, roller blinds and an outside security door adding to its protection.
With NBN connection and double gates adding security to the yard, this property could work for a small home business (STCA) while also providing a great base for a young family. This great property also lends itself to subdivision potential (STCA).
Positioned just moments from the centre of Creswick on the Clunes Road, this property is benefitted by passing traffic as well as nearby Flemo?s General Store. Creswick is a delightful town to live with ease, while also providing great connection to Ballarat (18 minutes), Daylesford (25 minutes) or Maryborough just 40 minutes away. For further information, please contact our agent today.

Address: 310 Langdons Hill Road Langdons Hill VIC 3363
Description:
Views to the Country
Located just 15 minutes to Daylesford this charming immaculately presented Victorian, boasting panoramic views over the country side from just about every angle. Set on approx 3 acres of rich red soil, offering two paddocks, great fencing throughout and a 20m x 8m shed with power connected. Beautifully landscaped gardens with established fruit trees and fish pond.
The home offers three good sized bedrooms, bathroom, country kitchen with gas cooking, open plan living/dining, central heating/cooling, wood heater and full laundry/mudroom. French doors open out to the undercover veranda, the perfect spot to sit and enjoy the clean country air. All in walking distance to the Wombat State Forest. This versatile property would be an ideal hobby farm, family home or weekender.
- 15 min to Daylesford, 90 min to Melbourne, 35 mins to Ballarat
- 20m x 8m Shed with power, concreted dairy shedding
-Stock yards with loading ramp & horse fencing
- Bore water suitable for drinking plus tank water
- Telephone line & NBN fast internet connection available
Inspections are by private appointment and are recommended.

Description:
Sound Brick Home on a Stunning 7 Acre Allotment
This is truly a lifestyle property, completely neat and well set out; this 2.86 Ha (approx 7acres) hobby farm provides walking distance to the thriving township of Creswick, as well as room to play. Strikingly handsome inside and out, this brick veneer home stands proudly within an orderly garden, to the front as well as to the back. With a water system hooked up to the twelve raised vegetable gardens and tank water quenching the orchard and garden thirst, this fully fenced house block is designed for self-sufficiency, plus township convenience. Re-energised with Baltic pine floorboards, this home features a stunning French provincial kitchen, which gives character and elegance to this important hub. A fresh light living room, three good size bedrooms, family bathroom and separate laundry all create a simple yet manageable design and floorplan. A wood heater and the lead light doors give warmth and personality to the lounge while the split system is strategically placed for touch of the button' temperature control. The land is predominantly pasture with many extra features that will turn country living into exciting ventures for growing children. Two horse yards create excellent provisions for horse lovers, while the shedding contributes to vehicle and machinery coverage. There is handy wood shed, a double lock up garage with workshop and remote door, along with a single lock up with an enclosed toilet. Town water and tank water are connected with NBN optic fibre providing quick internet service for working at home. The local primary school is just minutes away, while commuting to Ballarat is only a 15 km drive. Small holdings or hobby farms that are well maintained can produce a sideline income while providing self-sufficiency and satisfaction. With a great outlook and a quiet location, this mini farm will suit a myriad of buyers. Call today for further details and inspection times.

Description:
Ideal Country Retreat With Amazing Views
Beautiful established trees frame this property, while extended views of the rolling hills of Springmount provide a magical backdrop. Positioned in the serene region of Springmount, this property provides easy connection to Creswick via the Midland Highway, along with an approx. 20 minute drive to either Daylesford and/or Ballarat.
Just over 1 hectare or 2.5 acres, this cleared land is ideal for growing families looking for room to ride a motorbike, ride a horse or just enjoy the serenity of the peaceful surrounds while also offering room for your beloved family and pets.
Constructed through the 70?s and sitting proudly on the slight rise to benefit the views, this triple fronted brick veneer home offers three bedrooms, a delightful sunroom, a rear veranda and a practical galley style kitchen which offers an abundant of storage and bench space while providing room to prepare the ?day to day? meals while conversing with family or friends. The lounge has been freshly painted with new slimline blinds complimenting the palette, and a cosy freestanding wood heater and strategically placed split system add to the overall comfort of the room. A splash of colour has been added to the master, while the family bathroom has been completely renovated for a modern contemporary edge for everyday grooming and hygiene.
The raised timber deck with clears is perfect for entertaining friends for a larger dinner party, while the elongated sunroom is another zone to sip a cuppa or just take advantage of the additional warmth generated from the large ceramic tiles.
This very comfortable home provides: good fencing, NBN connection, town water, two water tanks equalling 5,000 litres, double bay carport, smaller work shed and of course the serenity of living on the rural outskirts of Creswick.
For further details, call our agent today.

Description:
Splendid Family Home & Oh What A Shed
This young, but renovated beauty is sure to please the entire family. Larger than expected from the road this four bedroom abode has great proportions throughout with each bedroom taking your larger suites. Off the master is a north facing office which also could be a nursery or library. The new kitchen is bound to delight with 900mm oven and other stainless steel appliances. The home has new floor coverings and the residence has been freshly painted. There's heating, cooling and ceiling fans for all year comfort. The rear yard is vast and displays a huge pergola area for entertaining. The north facing front veranda is enjoyed by the owner while looking over countryside or reading the paper. An immense 8x15m garage can hold over four vehicles and has the height you require to grant access for your full sized caravan. There is ample power points and lights for the handy man. The property locale is quiet and convenient being just three minutes to the hub of town.

Description:
Great Sheds, Great Home Just A Short Walk From Town Centre
With quality updates evident throughout, this three bedroom brick veneer home now offers a shining example of a fashionable residence set on a fabulous 5700m2 allotment. With walking distance to the thriving town centre of Creswick yet offering a beautiful country aspect, this property provides a more than adequate balance of shedding, land and home. Ideal for a small hobby farm, horse or motorbike enthusiasts or maybe a panel beater or spray painter looking at a home business (STCA) - this property will certainly tempt a diverse range of purchasers. Large windows provide loads of light while the open plan creates a fabulous area to entertain family or guests either inside or out.
An updated kitchen is finished with floating floors and stainless steel appliances, while the dining area and lounge offer a neutral palette and soft window furnishings. Glass sliding doors lead you through to a generous pergola with sun protective laser lite, built in barbecue, four person spa and established shrubs shielding the outdoor entertaining zone. All bedrooms provide built in robes with gas central heating and plush grey carpet along with a central family bathroom, independent laundry and separate toilet.
Positioned perfectly toward the front on a very large block with scattered gums bordering the boundaries, this property offers a single carport, a massive 18x9m shed with an adjoining 9x9m shed that boasts built in work benches, power and concrete floors along with a variety of other smaller sheds. Just 15 minutes to the CBD of Ballarat along with excellent connection the Western Freeway and beyond. For a lifestyle change, call our friendly staff at our Creswick office for further details and inspection times.
With loads of options, - this property is priced to sell!!!

Description:
Stunning Brand New Home
In ship shape condition and promising years of low maintenance, this energy efficient steel framed new JG King build will delight those looking for an easy ?new home? option with a great outlook across the roof tops of charming Creswick.
Designed to take advantage of the views and to benefit from maximum use of the sloping allotment to the rear, this home is walking distance to the township; just 25minutes to Daylesford and a quick 15minute commute to nearby Ballarat.
Passing by the formal lounge, the effective wide timber laminate flooring creates a durable base from the front door right through to the kitchen, dining and living room, while the three bedrooms have been styled with deep grey ?wall to wall? carpet, built in robes and slimline blinds. The master suite is pampered by a handy ensuite, walk in robes and views from the large front window, while the cool grey palette provides a great base to add your own embellishments and personal décor. A walk in linen press is present in the capacious independent laundry, while the family bathroom and separate toilet cover the balance of the hygiene facilities with contemporary ease.
Designed with loads of light and masses of room, the kitchen not only boasts a three point working triangle, it also offers a walk in pantry, granite benchtops, central island and excellent storage facilities. The adjoining dining zone is designed to enable easy connection with the chef, while also offering interaction with those relaxing either inside or out. Sliding doors open onto a well protected entertaining space, which also provides a peaceful zone to sip a wine, read a paper or join friends for a coffee. Ducted heating and cooling keep the home comfortable with a double lock up garage with internal access (and rear roller door) allowing movement about the back yard if necessary.
With extra room to play with at the rear, this 802m2 property could profit from further landscaping to incorporate the elevation of the land and the views across the town, while also providing a further area to erect a shed or additional alfresco (STCA). School bus pick up is just metres away, therefore this home will provide the perfect place for families to grow.

Description:
EVERYTHING YOU WANT
Inspection by appointment only. This beautifully presented property enjoys a prime location in Newlyn, just 10 minutes from Daylesford, 5 minutes to Creswick and around 25 mins to Ballarat. Set in a quiet and friendly residential area on approx 2400 sq.m. (over half an acre) the home offers 4 spacious bedrooms, 2 generous living areas and large bright kitchen that opens to the undercover outdoor entertaining area. Freshly painted and light filled throughout, this home is perfect for permanent living, weekend use or rental investment.
- 4 large bedrooms - main with wide balcony, double walk-in robes, ensuite bathroom
- 2 large and versatile open plan living areas
- Huge kitchen with plenty of bench space, large pantry, dishwasher, gas cooking
- Wide undercover outdoor entertaining area, wrap around verandahs and decks
- Main bathroom with shower, bath. Full laundry, separate toilet
- NBN internet, town water, mains power plus 3.29 Kw solar system (14 panels)
- Split system heating/cooling
- Double lockup garage, garden shedding, chook shed
- Huge block 2400 sq.m. with rich soil, established gardens, lawns
- Views over countryside to nearby hills
- 5 minute walk to Primary School, school bus to Ballarat nearby

Description:
Elevated Home With Views & Rear Access
Proudly elevated with fabulous views, this home along Melbourne Road offers beautiful manicured gardens, neat and tidy edges, garden water tanks, a bird aviary and a newly concreted driveway, to top it all off.
Every guest will capture a glimpse of the extended views and outlook when they visit this three bedroom family home, as the inviting veranda and front entrance are the major features of this well-built 1970?s cream brick veneer.
Elegantly dressed with quality drapes, vinyl laminate, carpet and tasteful light fittings, this home boasts a North facing formal lounge and dining area, along with a timber kitchen and electric cooking which also benefits from the elevated views and garden interest. All bedrooms with built in robes are built to one side and offer a lovely comfortable feel generated from the evaporative cooling and central ducted heating.
The family bathroom offers a double shower and spa bath. With a separate toilet and independent laundry covering all the hygiene necessities. A further sitting room has been stylishly tiled for a cool zone to read a book or sip a coffee, while the full width veranda to the rear also covers a sunny space to entertain family and friends throughout the season.
With a slight slope to the yard, and offering a further outdoor alfresco zone, this 1000m2 property also provides another room attached to the double lock up garage which is fully lined with new carpet and power (and is also accessible via a sealed road). This room also provides morning sunshine and an ideal set up for a home office (NBN connected to home), craft room or a teenager?s hang out.
Just 15 minutes to Ballarat, and a short drive to heart of Creswick, this home would be perfect for first home buyers, retirees or just as an upmarket investment. This is a good looking home, that should be inspected asap!

Description:
Tree Change on 15 Acres
Located 5 minutes to Creswick, 20 minutes to Ballarat and 15 minutes to Daylesford this magnificent Victoria residence offers 4 bedrooms with study, full of period features with large room sizes set on 15 fertile acres.
Currently on the rental market this property would be ideal for a lifestyle change, hobby farm or family home with plenty of space for horses. Horse facilities include stables, holding yards, good external fencing and double concreted lock up shed with power.
- 4 Bedrooms plus office/study
- Large living room with wood fire
- Rear decking with peaceful views
- Large concreted shed with power and plumbing
- Stables/holding yards
- Town & tank water plus dam
Inspections are by private appointment only and subject to advance notice.

Description:
Reserve Views And Future Goals To Be Kicked!
This tidy cream brick veneer boasts comfort, convenience and great potential. The spacious three bedroom home has fantastic natural light, ample heating & cooling and an updated kitchen. The extended family can appreciate the bungalow or alternatively utilise it as a home office. There are two separate garages for vehicle or workshop. A north facing yard overlooks the Doug Lindsay Reserve. The block may be considered ideal for either family activities or maybe development (STCA). The side lane way grants access to the rear yard. All this is just a one minute drive to the hub of town or a 30 second stroll to the train station.

Description:
20 Acres of Lifestyle, Privacy, Nature and Next To No Bills
This property represents a commitment to sustainable living, relaxation, living off grid and "ethical" lifestyle. The charming mud brick with 2 bedrooms has a solar system, tank water supply and discounted land rates for low cost living. The house is energy efficient. A garden area with 5 large vegie beds and established orchard with 18 trees add to the outlook. Delightful grassy woodland with tussocky grassy understorey & messmate & peppermint trees & wildflowers, mosses and lichens a feature throughout the acreage. A wildlife population including koalas, echidnas, roos and wallabies are frequent visitors. Diverse bird population of honeyeaters, whistlers, tree creeper and robins make home at this Trust for Nature Covenanted property. Located 5 mins from Creswick near Broomfield, 20 mins to Ballarat. Close to Daylesford, Castlemaine, Grampians and Melbourne.

Description:
Architectural Designed Home From The 50's
With a timeless faade and an architectural design, this home will provide a retro elegance, a family friendly floorplan and the ability to further add your own individuality and creativity to this quality build. Proudly sitting high on an approx. 2617m2 allotment, and presented with a skillion roofline, wide brick chimney and a mix of brick and timber, this home boasts a long concreted formal driveway, a detached matching double garage (plus single carport) and manicured gardens filled with perfumes, colours and scattered established feature trees.
Owned and cared for by the one family for approx. 60 years, this architectural home greets you a wide formal hallway, an impressive elegant sun filled lounge with high transom windows, an open fire and double glass doors that lead you through to another living and/or dining room. A magnificent built in wall unit and gas heater as well as natural gas ducted heating create a sense of masculinity, while pendant lighting, quality drapes and cosy carpet provide a nostalgic 50's touch, fit for various levels of entertainment.
The kitchen also provides original features with timber cupboards and drawers, laminate benches and a cute little breakfast nook adding to its appeal. All bedrooms are generous in size and offer built in robes, while the bathroom and independent laundry offer serviceable areas for daily grooming and hygiene levels with a hint of deco creeping through.
A security system and NBN are added extras, while two water tanks and a separate wood shed add further options when gardening or fuelling the fire. Extensive paving, concreted ramps and an inbuilt outdoor fireplace also add a further place to entertain with style. This magnificent property is within walking distance to the heart of the town, where recreational, sporting, schooling and social outings are abundant. Creswick provides public transport options, along with a short commute to Ballarat and/ or Melbourne via the Midland and Western highways, along with a beautiful scenic route to Daylesford in just over 20 minutes.
If you are looking for a new heritage stylish home with a timeless faade and botanic like' gardens, then this four bedroom home will ensure you are certainly at the top of your game. Call today for further details.

Description:
Loughlin Park' - 197.68 Acres of Productivity
Loughlin Park' is located 20 minutes North of Ballarat, 15 minutes from Daylesford & 10 minutes to Creswick and offers 197.68 acres or 80 hectares on one title with two sealed road frontages. Highly productive, this farm is one of the best examples of Farm Management you will find.
Zoned Farming, the current owners have renovated the pastures and improved production with the application of poultry manure and lime, and have direct drilled 90% of pastures over the last 10 years. The soil types vary from Red, Grey to Black Loam. There are 10 paddocks with troughs fed by town water, 4 dams and an unequipped stock bore insuring an abundance of water in the toughest of seasons.
The undercover working improvements are outstanding with the cattle yards (handling 100+ head), scales, a vet crush and adjustable loading race combined with high quality lighting via 3ph and 240v power enables work at night. Three large hay shed that hold approx. 600 large bales plus a large machinery shed with 3ph power add to the properties working facilities. The property currently carries approx. 100 grown head of Angus cattle. There is also 9 additional acres in which are currently leased by the Vendors from council, and could potentially be carried on by the new owners (STCA).
A comfortable 3 bedroom brick veneer home with open plan living, electric cooking, gas hot water system, wood heating, reverse cycle air conditioning and town water makes for comfortable living. The home also has potential to be leased at approx. $250 per week.
This is a rare opportunity not to be missed as Loughlin Park Black Angus' are renowned quality beasts and all are A1 blood line. This property could easily be run as a horse breeding or agistment property as the facilities are easily converted if desired.
Note: 30 acres of sown pasture that produced 150 large square bales last year will be locked away for the new owner to cut hay (conditions apply). Available to purchase separately is the livestock and more than 500 straws of semen which are approx. worth between $100 - 500 per straw.
Bonus Inclusions: The Vendors will include approx. 300 big square bales plus 250 bales of silage and a quantity of lime and poultry manure. This has a current value of approx. $50,000
Expressions of Interest close 9th September at 4.00PM at the offices of PRD Nationwide Ballarat and PRD Nationwide Buninyong.
PRD Nationwide Agents in Conjunction: Neville Dooly 0419 307 882 & Chris Leonard 0409 0409 23.
